text:
Firearms Amendment Act 2007

An Act to amend the Firearms Act 1996 and certain regulations under that Act and to make related amendments to the Police Offences Act 1935
[Royal Assent 13 November 2007]

Be it enacted by His Excellency the Governor of Tasmania, by and with the advice and consent of the Legislative Council and House of Assembly, in Parliament assembled, as follows:

PART 1 - Preliminary

1. Short title
    This Act may be cited as the Firearms Amendment Act 2007 .

2. Commencement
        (1) Except as provided by this section, this Act commences on the day on which this Act receives the Royal Assent.
        (2) The provisions of Part 3 commence on a day or days to be proclaimed.

PART 2 - Firearms Act 1996 Amended

3.

PART 6 - Further Amendment, &c., of Firearms Regulations 2006

70. Further amendment, &c., of Firearms Regulations 2006
    The amendments of the Firearms Regulations 2006 effected by Part 5 are not to be taken as preventing their subsequent amendment or rescission by regulation.
